DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-COMPLETO: Patricia de Oliveira Dias Porto Carreiro
DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: PORTO CARREIRO, P.;PORTOCARREIRO, P.;CARREIRO, P. P.;Porto Carreiro, Patrícia

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Arquitetura e Urbanismo pela Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1990), mestrado em Arquitetura e Urbanismo pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte (2007) e doutoranda no Programa de Pós-graduação em Ambiente Construído e Patrimônio Sustentável (PG-ACPS) da Escola de Arquitetura (EA) da UFMG. Professora da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE), na área de Tenologias Digitais aplicadas à Arquitetura, Urbanismo e Paisagismo.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Zeladoria Cidadã _ ZCivis: plataforma digital para a autogestão cidadã da Paisagem Urbana e o cuidado preventivo do Patrimônio construído da Cidade.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: ZCivis propõe uma pesquisa que materializa uma plataforma digital para a gestão cidadã da Paisagem Urbana através da manutenção, salvaguarda e preservação do patrimônio construído da Cidade, em processo de tombamento ou, preventivamente, como guarda da memória coletiva.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TEXTO.TITULO-DO-TEXTO: Asynchronous Mode in the Webgis: A Challenge to Ensure Greater Popular Participation.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TEXTO.TITULO-DO-TEXTO-INGLES: Asynchronous Mode in the Webgis: A Challenge to Ensure Greater Popular Participation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TEXTO.TITULO-DO-JORNAL-OU-REVISTA: International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Patricia de Oliveira Dias Porto Carreiro

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract. The covid-19 pandemic has resumed old discussions about the virtual
environments´ different functionalities needed to subsidize online activities
synchronously (in real-time) or asynchronously (not in real-time). This article
discusses the inclusion of features in the webgis to ensure that their activities
can be promoted in a totally asynchronous way, especially when they aim at
popular participation. The discussion was developed within the Geodesign Brazil project, which promoted 12 similar workshops, between March and April
2021, each in a metropolitan region of Brazilian capitals. The project focused
on the use of Geodesign supported by Giscolab (Brazilian online platform for
Geodesign) to identify problems and create territorial proposals on 10 themes
(water infrastructure, agriculture, green infrastructure, energy infrastructure,
transport infrastructure, industry and commerce, institutional, residential, tourism and culture, carbon storage). Specifically, this article reports the experience
that took place in the Recife metropolitan region?s workshop, capital of Pernambuco, state of Northeast Brazil. Since it was decided to apply asynchronous
dynamics, adjustments and additions of resources were necessary to make it viable, mostly to ensure users? interest, participation and linkage to the project.
The asynchronous mode in webgis is a challenge, as it requires resources for
greater clarity in the definition of activities; forms of feedback and personification of users' paths and to incentivize the users to complete the activities proposed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Mapas Mentais e Ferramentas Computacionais na Gestão da Informação do Processo de Ensino Projetual da Arquitetura, Urbanismo e Paisagismo.
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Mind Maps and Computational Tools in the Information Management in the Process of Design Teaching in Architecture, Urbanism and Landscaping.

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Patricia de Oliveira Dias Porto Carreiro

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article relates a teaching experience in the discipline ?InfoAU II? at the CAU/UFPE/Brasil. One of the objectives is working with the students reflection about the design as a multidisciplinary knowledge integration process. The other one is opening a discussion about the importance in the Information management in the process of design teaching in Architecture, Urbanism and Landscaping within digital environments. The methodology involves a construction of mind maps on paper and digital format (using the software Prezi) as a tool for registration of design process, which it shows the requirement to get deeply in seeking methodologies and tools for a reflexive design teaching.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Asynchronous Mode in the Webgis: A Challenge to Ensure Greater Popular Participation.
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Asynchronous Mode in the Webgis: A Challenge to Ensure Greater Popular Participation

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Patricia de Oliveira Dias Porto Carreiro

environments´ different functionalities needed to subsidize online activities
synchronously (in real-time) or asynchronously (not in real-time). This article
discusses the inclusion of features in the webgis to ensure that their activities
can be promoted in a totally asynchronous way, especially when they aim at
popular participation. The discussion was developed within the Geodesign Brazil project, which promoted 12 similar workshops, between March and April
2021, each in a metropolitan region of Brazilian capitals. The project focused
on the use of Geodesign supported by Giscolab (Brazilian online platform for
Geodesign) to identify problems and create territorial proposals on 10 themes
(water infrastructure, agriculture, green infrastructure, energy infrastructure,
transport infrastructure, industry and commerce, institutional, residential, tourism and culture, carbon storage). Specifically, this article reports the experience
that took place in the Recife metropolitan region?s workshop, capital of Pernambuco, state of Northeast Brazil. Since it was decided to apply asynchronous
dynamics, adjustments and additions of resources were necessary to make it viable, mostly to ensure users? interest, participation and linkage to the project.
The asynchronous mode in webgis is a challenge, as it requires resources for
greater clarity in the definition of activities; forms of feedback and personification of users' paths and to incentivize the users to complete the activities proposed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: CIDADES CRIATIVAS: ECONOMIA CRIATIVA, INOVAÇÃO E TECNOLOGIA
GEODESING: Uma potencial abordagem de ensino de projeto para o Curso de Arquitetura e Urbanismo da UFPE
